"Help Heal Mama Earth" is an initiative to bring the community together by cleaning it together. Typically clean sweeps do not target the most dirty areas of the city and they often go unnoticed, this program combats that by setting up in these neighborhoods once a month and providing walk up services, activities, and events to the community. Not only can you help heal mama earth but you can heal yourself through free yoga, free art projects, and even a food pantry to take food home. People of all ages are welcomed.

At Vertus, our mission is to develop leaders of character for the community, and we're proud to support this initiative, just another part of the #VertusDifference!

Vertus is reinventing high school for young men who need it the most. Our innovative program is built around evidence-based practices for urban education and supported by Preceptors, full-time mentors dedicated to the well-being of small groups of students. Through daily character curriculum, personalized support, and real-world practice of leadership and responsibility, Vertus students develop personal strengths such as grit, social intelligence, and self-control. Beginning in their first year, students are exposed to career and college preparation opportunities that equip our young men with the technical and learning skills they will need to succeed after high school.

Is this what you want for your young man? We’re currently recruiting for this school year. Visit vertusschool.org or call (585) 747-8911 to speak to a member of our recruitment team.

Vertus Deans are central to the creation and maintenance of a positive, consistent, caring, and disciplined school culture.

Many Vertus students come from underperforming schools and have experienced a variety of educational, social, and personal disadvantages that stack the odds against them. All parts of the #VertusDifference! Learn more and apply today at vertusschool.org.

A majority of students in the United States live in low-income households and face challenges different than those living in affluent households. Education is integral to intellectual, emotional, and physical development, but schools often come up short in meeting the unique needs of disadvantaged students.

The #VertusDifference is built around evidence-based methods to meet the unique needs of Rochester’s urban youth. Our 24/7 Preceptors, character development curriculum, personalized academics, and college and career preparation programs help students envision a positive future, build confidence in their abilities to set and meet goals, and strengthen the motivation needed to continually rise to the challenges of life.

Please do not hesitate to reach out to the school with any questions or concerns. We will continue to monitor the situation and communicate any new news and developments with you as soon as we have them. Stay safe, stay healthy.

COVID-19 Update - March 27, 2020

Governor Cuomo has recently extended all school closures through April 14th. As we continue to educate our young men from a distance, please be assured that their academic program has been largely uninterrupted. They should continue to work on their core classes on Edgenuity for at least 45 minutes per class per day. Classroom teachers have uploaded their class materials to Edgenuity as well, and students can ask for help through email. Your son’s Preceptor will continue to reach out and facilitate any other requests or needs you may be experiencing during this difficult time.

The Vertus Family has united to ensure that you and your family can get academic and emotional support during this health crisis. Please do not hesitate to reach out to the school with any questions or concerns. We will continue to monitor the situation and communicate any new news and developments with you as soon as we have them. Stay safe, stay healthy.
